question: Which Indian has been elected as chairperson of the Governing Body of the International Labour Organisation (ILO) ?
explanation:
The Labour and Employment Secretary of India Apurva Chandra has been elected as the Chairperson of the Governing Body of the International Labour Organisation (ILO) for the period October 2020 - June 2021.
He is a 1988 batch of the Indian Administrative Service (IAS) of Maharashtra Cadre. With this, India has assumed the leadership of ILO after a period of 35 years.
